articles.description: The US rapper claimed that the pop stars’ management bought 30,000 copies of their charity duet, denying him the US No 1 spot
articles.content:
Ariana Grande and Justin Bieber have denied allegations made by the rapper Tekashi 6ix9ine that they bought their way to the US No 1 spot.
6ix9ine claimed that the pair who are both managed by Scooter Braun had bought 30,000 copies of their charity single, S… [+2779 chars]

articles.title: Strictly star Neil Jones' explosive love life as he confirms his sexuality - Mirror Online
articles.description: Strictly's Neil Jones is on the look out for love on a dating app as he confirms his sexuality after his marriage ended
articles.content:
Neil Jones has cleared up any speculation on his sexuality.
The Strictly star put himself back on the dating market as he popped up on dating app Hinge in January earlier this year after his marriage to Katya collapsed.

articles.content:
